title: microsoft
setsapart: Among the first giant tech companies, its size and diversity of lines of business continue to grow.
caption: Aerial shot of the Microsoft campus in Redmond.

title: symetra
whatitdoes: Provides life insurance, employee benefits and retirement investments through brokers, agents and banks.
setsapart: Retirement investments, such as annuities, represent half its revenues.
caption: Symetra's headquarters in downtown Bellevue.

title: micron
whatitdoes: Makes semiconductor memory components such as DRAM and NAND flash memory chips, as well as a variety of solid state drives.
setsapart: It has the broadest memory chip and drive portfolio in the industry, with over 20,000 patents.
caption: CEO Mark Durcan at company headquarters.

title: f5
whatitdoes: Offers software and hardware that optimizes application delivery and security over data networks.
setsapart: It holds more than a 50 percent share of the application delivery controller market.
caption: The data center at F5's Seattle headquarters.

title: expedia
whatitdoes: Through more than a dozen different brands — Expedia.com, Hotels.com, Hotwire.com, CarRentals.com, Tavelocity — Expedia allows travelers to research, plan and book travel around the world.
setsapart: This spinoff from Microsoft has grown into one of the largest online travel agencies in the world.
caption: A plane lands at SeaTac International Airport.
